decks.notes: The deck revolves around controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their permanents, and taking extra turns to gain advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through card advantage and powerful spells. The commander, Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, provides card selection and recursion for key spells. High Tide and extra turn spells help generate mana and pull ahead in resources. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Teferi, Temporal Archmage, ensuring a strong late game presence. With a focus on resource denial and card advantage, this control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 format.

The Tasigur control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to efficiently answer threats while generating card advantage through cards like Baleful Strix, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Sylvan Library. Tasigur's ability to manipulate the graveyard allows for flexibility in spell selection and recursion with cards like Reanimate and Mystic Confluence. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Upheaval and planeswalkers such as Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and enable the deck's powerful spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. With Tasigur, the Golden Fang as the commander, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly disrupting their game plan while gradually gaining advantage through card draw and recursion. The deck utilizes a variety of versatile spells such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to answer threats and maintain control of the battlefield. By efficiently managing resources and making strategic decisions, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategies, and eventually win the game through attrition. It relies on Tasigur's ability to recur important spells and generate card advantage to outlast the opponent and emerge victorious.

This Aggro deck revolves around utilizing Titania, Protector of Argoth's ability to create Elemental tokens by sacrificing lands. The main focus is on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Rampant Growth, Green Sun's Zenith, and Utopia Sprawl to bring out powerful creatures such as Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes land destruction elements like Wasteland and Tectonic Edge to disrupt opponents' mana bases while ensuring the deck's own land recursion with cards like Crucible of Worlds and Life from the Loam. The overall strategy is to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of Elementals and powerful creatures, all while keeping a strong mana base and applying pressure with aggressive plays.

The main idea behind this deck is to assemble a wide range of powerful mana creatures and utility cards to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently while also having access to a toolbox of creatures with Captain Sisay's ability. With a focus on aggro strategies, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and combat tricks. Cards like Avacyn's Pilgrim, Birds of Paradise, and Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary help accelerate mana production, while creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, and Sigarda, Host of Herons provide strong disruptive threats. The deck also includes powerful utility lands and equipment to support its aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Grand Arbiter Augustin IV serves as the commander, providing a cost reduction for spells and slowing down the opponent's plays. The deck includes a variety of counterspells like Mana Leak, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command to prevent the opponent from resolving key threats. Removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile deal with problematic creatures, while card draw spells like Ponder and Serum Visions ensure a steady stream of resources. The deck aims to out-value and out-control the opponent, eventually winning through incremental advantage and powerful finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sphinx's Revelation.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, bouncing permanents, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. By utilizing powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, as well as disruptive spells like Delay and Daze, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The inclusion of versatile cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provides additional card advantage and flexibility in handling threats. The creature package consists of efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis and Delver of Secrets, supported by disruptive creatures like Venser, Shaper Savant and Tidebinder Mage. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Roast and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource for powerful combos and reanimation spells. By filling up the graveyard with cards like Buried Alive and Reanimate, the deck aims to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Necrotic Ooze to dominate the battlefield. Cards like Dance of the Dead and Animate Dead also play a crucial role in reanimating creatures. Additionally, the deck includes various removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Damnation to control the opponent's board while also generating card advantage with cards like Phyrexian Arena and Dark Confidant. With a strong mana base and a range of tutors like Demonic Tutor and Grim Tutor, the deck is designed to efficiently set up powerful combos and overwhelm the opponent.
